  "description": "Herbal Goodness is a manufacturer of premium quality, unique, organic, non-GMO superfoods, and herbal products to support healthy living and impact lives. The company is unique in its values of Quality, Sustainability, and Impact. 100% women and minority-owned, Herbal Goodness believes in Business for social good. We donate 10% of our profits to promote the education of girls.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accounting Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja (Remote)
Department: Finance &amp; Accounting
Reports To: CFO
Employment Type:&nbsp;(Part-Time, 20 hours/week) &ndash; 4-Month Engagement

Position Summary


	We are seeking a detail-oriented&nbsp;Part-Time Accounting Manager&nbsp;for a 4-month engagement (18&ndash;20 hours per week).
	This role is responsible for overseeing day-to-day accounting operations, managing financial reporting, ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements, and supporting ERP system migration efforts.
	The ideal candidate will have experience across both manufacturing and e-commerce operations, with strong technical skills in QuickBooks Online (QBO), Synder, and Zoho.


Key Responsibilities
Daily Accounting Operations &amp; Vendor Management(50%):


	Manage general ledger, accounts payable, accounts receivable, and payroll processing.
	Oversee daily cash positions, bank reconciliations, and payment processing.
	Process journal entries, account reconciliations, and maintain the chart of accounts.
	Manage Synder mappings and resolve negative inventory issues.
	Build and assemble inventory within QuickBooks Online.
	Ensure adherence to accounting procedures and internal controls.
	Handle vendor payments and collections through Melio.
	Vendor management, purchase order management.
	Inventory reconciliation monthly
	Manage monthly Nigerian bank accounts and reconciliations via Zoho.


Monthly/Quarterly Reporting (20%):


	Lead month-end and quarter-end close processes within established deadlines.
	Prepare financial statements (P&amp;L, Balance Sheet, Cash Flow) in accordance with GAAP.
	Generate management reports for leadership decision-making.
	Maintain fixed asset records, depreciation schedules, and capital expenditure tracking.
	Coordinate with external auditors and manage audit documentation as needed.


ERP System Management &amp; Support (20%):


	Execute comprehensive QBO data cleanup and preparation for ERP migration (chart of accounts, customer/vendor records, inventory data, historical transactions).
	Provide user support, troubleshooting, and system maintenance.
	Safeguard data integrity, system backups, and security protocols.
	Validate migrated data accuracy and resolve data discrepancies.


Compliance &amp; Controls (10%):


	Ensure tax compliance for Nigerian entities, including monthly VAT and annual filings.
	Maintain internal controls over financial reporting.
	Manage regulatory reporting requirements and filing deadlines.
	Develop and update accounting policies and procedures.
	Conduct internal control testing and remediate deficiencies.


Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)


	Month-End Close Timeline:&nbsp;Within 5 business days.
	Financial Reporting Accuracy:&nbsp;97.5% error-free.
	Tax Filing Compliance:&nbsp;100% on-time filings.
	Cash Forecast Accuracy:&nbsp;95% accuracy.
	A/P Processing Time:&nbsp;Average &lt;3 days.
	A/R Collection Efficiency (GNC):&nbsp;&lt;30 days DSO.
	Internal Control Deficiencies:&nbsp;Zero high-risk findings.
	Data Migration Accuracy:&nbsp;99.9% data integrity.
	Inventory Efficiency: 100% reconciled monthly cycle within 7 business days
	QBO Data Cleanup:&nbsp;100% of identified issues resolved pre-migration.


Qualifications


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field (CPA or equivalent preferred).
	5+ years of accounting experience, including month-end close and financial reporting.
	Strong knowledge of GAAP and internal controls.
	Hands-on experience with&nbsp;QuickBooks Online (QBO), Synder, Zoho, and Melio.
	Experience with inventory accounting and e-commerce/manufacturing operations.
	Strong Excel and data analysis skills.
	Ability to manage multiple priorities and meet deadlines in a part-time capacity.

title: Job Vacancies at Oando Plc
content:
Oando Plc is one of Africa’s largest integrated energy solutions provider with a proud heritage. It has a primary listing on the Nigeria Stock Exchange and a secondary listing on the Johannesburg Stock Exchange. With shared values of Teamwork, Respect, Integrity, Passion and Professionalism (TRIPP).

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Senior Operations Analyst

Job Location: Lagos
Job Title: Full-Time
Reports to: SVP, Technology & Innovation

Job Purpose
     

            
    




	The Senior Operations Analyst will play a critical role in analyzing and optimizing the organization’s operational processes to enhance efficiency, improve performance, and support strategic goals.
	By leveraging data-driven insights, the Senior Operation Analyst will ensure seamless day-to-day operations while identifying opportunities for process improvements, cost savings, and increased productivity.


Job Responsibilities


	Evaluate current operational workflows and identify inefficiencies or bottlenecks.
	Develop and recommend actionable strategies for process improvement.
	Collect, analyze, and interpret operational data to generate meaningful insights.
	Support regulatory compliance reporting and performance tracking.
	Support the planning and execution of operational projects.
	Monitor project progress, timelines, and deliverables to ensure alignment with organizational objectives.
	Identify risks and recommend mitigation strategies.
	Analyze operational costs and identify areas for cost reduction.
	Assist in budgeting and forecasting activities.
	Monitor expenditures to ensure adherence to approved budgets.
	Collaborate with operations, finance, and technical teams to improve operational deliverables
	Maintain comprehensive documentation of operational processes and procedures.
	Ensure compliance with organizational policies, standards, and regulatory requirements.
	Serve as a liaison between departments and partner organizations to ensure seamless communication and coordination.
	Provide support for ad hoc analyses and special projects as needed.
	Train team members (attendants and field workers) on tools, processes, and best practices.


Key Performance Indicators


	Quality, comprehensiveness, timeliness and accuracy of analysis and management decisions
	Quality, depth of analysis and usefulness of recommendations proffered.
	Accuracy and timeliness of output.
	Effectiveness of analytical support provided,
	Levels of adherence to policies, processes and procedures


Job Specifications
Qualification & Experience:


	1st Degree in Business Administration, Operations Management, Industrial Engineering, or a related field from a reputable University.
	8 – 10 years of post - NYSC experience in operations, business analysis, operating environment or a similar role
	MBA or relevant professional development in Finance, Management Science & Operations Research and Mergers and Acquisition.
	Expert understanding and application of renewable economics, risk and decision science and Nigerian fiscal systems.
	Proven competencies in using Data Analytics and Microsoft Office software programs.


Key Competencies:


	Strategic Thinker
	Strong numerical, analytical and problem-solving skills with strong attention to detail.
	Ability to translate data insights into actionable business recommendations.
	Business performance monitoring and reporting.
	Networking & Relationship Management.
	Oral, written & visual communication and stakeholder management abilities.
	Self-starter with a keen sense of judgment, decisiveness and self-discipline, creativity and innovation.
	Team player with a strong ability to manage and lead multi-disciplinary teams.
	Effective management, coaching and development of team consistent with corporate objectives and individual aspirations
	Expert and Deep understanding of Renewable industry and its Dynamics


Working Conditions:


	Fast-paced, data-driven, and innovation-focused work environment.
	This position may require occasional travel to project sites or company offices.
	The role will typically involve hybrid work with a mix of in-office and remote tasks.


Click here to apply online

 

2.) Investor Relations Analyst

Job Location: Lagos
Job Title: Full-Time
Reports to: Investor Relations & Corporate Development Manager

Job Purpose


	The Investor Relations Analyst (IRA) is responsible for executing the company’s investor relations operating plan, delivering accurate, timely, and compelling communication to the investment community.
	The role focuses on preparing investor-facing materials, conducting investor-specific analysis, and managing the logistics and data required for effective shareholder and analyst engagement. In addition, the IRA will support the integration of environmental, social and governance (ESG) considerations into investor communications and analysis, ensuring alignment with global norms and investor expectations.
	Working under the guidance of the Investor Relations & Corporate Development Manager, the IRA maintains robust investor databases, tracks market sentiment, and supports investor events and communications. This role is execution-oriented and complements the Corporate Development Officer’s strategic oversight by providing the detailed analysis, reporting, and logistical coordination necessary for high-quality IR delivery.


Internal Contacts:


	Corporate Comms
	Finance
	Governance
	Legal
	Sustainability
	Operations Teams


External Contacts:


	Institutional and retail investors
	Sell-side analysts and brokerage firms
	Stock exchange representatives
	Investor conference organisers and event coordinators


Scope of Responsibility & Accountability


	Execution of approved Investor Relations plans and initiatives
	Preparation and maintenance of investor communication materials
	Delivery of market and shareholder analysis for investor purposes
	Management of investor databases and the IR section of the company website
	Coordination of investor events and meetings logistics
	Monitoring and summarising peer news, analyst coverage, and shareholder register movements
	Support the Investor Relations Manager in monitoring, analysing, and communicating ESG performance and ratings to the investment community


Major Responsibility Area
Investor Engagement Execution:


	Prepare investor-facing materials for financial results announcements (press releases, presentations, fact sheets, Q&A documents, company profile)
	Maintain and update the IR website with accurate, timely information
	Coordinate logistics for investor roadshows, conferences, and meetings.
	Draft responses to investor queries in consultation with the IRM.


Market & Shareholder Analysis:


	Collect and analyse investor and analyst feedback, shareholder register movements, and market sentiment.
	Conduct investor-specific competitor analysis and benchmarking.
	Monitor peer company news and analyst reports, providing weekly summaries to the IRM.
	Monitor ESG-related analyst reports, controversies, and ratings (e.g., ISS ESG, MSCI, Sustainalytics) and prepare briefings for management.
	Analyse peer ESG disclosures and benchmarks to identify gaps in Oando’s reporting from an investor perspective


Database & Performance Tracking:


	Maintain an accurate and complete investor database and mailing list.
	Track and report on IR activity metrics (e.g., number of meetings, coverage changes, sentiment trends).


Content & Communication Support:


	Collaborate with Corporate Communications to ensure consistent and compliant investor messaging.
	Support preparation of scripts, speeches, and talking points for investor events.
	Incorporate ESG data and narratives into investor materials, presentations, and disclosures.
	Collaborate with the Sustainability team to ensure alignment between technical ESG disclosures and investor-facing communication.


Job Specification & Core Competencies
Qualifications & Experience:


	Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Finance, Economics, or related discipline
	Minimum of 3–5 years of experience in investor relations, capital markets, or financial analysis role
	Strong understanding of financial statements and capital markets
	High proficiency in Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, and Word
	Strong analytical, presentation, and communication skills
	Ability to manage multiple deadlines with attention to detail
	Proven ability to handle confidential and sensitive information


Core Competencies:


	Financial & market analysis
	Investor communications writing and formatting
	Event coordination and logistics
	Database management and maintenance
	Relationship management
	Attention to detail and execution focus.

title: Job Openings at Standard Bearers School
content:
Standard Bearers School was founded on January 7, 1997, during a time when Nigeria’s education system faced declining standards despite the rise of many schools. With a small team of passionate educators and a handful of pupils, SBS was established with a clear vision: to create a school that gives equal importance to academic excellence and creativity.
     

            
    



More than just a school, SBS is a close-knit community that offers a well-rounded educational experience in a modern, technology-driven learning environment. We celebrate the individuality of every child, guiding them on a journey of self-discovery while nurturing independence, confidence, and responsibility. Our goal is to provide a strong foundation that prepares our students to become capable and responsible members of society.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Assistant French Language Educator

Job Location: Lekki Phase 1, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking an Assistant French Language Educator at Standard Bearers School, whowill help students develop fluency and confidence in French while deepening their cultural awareness.
	The role involves delivering engaging lessons, designing creative learning resources, assessing student progress, and fostering a positive, inclusive classroom environment.


Key Responsibilities


	Plan and deliver French lessons across different proficiency levels.
	Teach spoken and written French, including grammar, vocabulary, and conversation.
	Create engaging lesson plans and resources that suit diverse learning styles.
	Assess student progress through oral and written evaluations, providing constructive feedback.
	Organize cultural activities that immerse students in French culture and traditions.
	Maintain accurate records of attendance, performance, and progress.
	Use technology, digital platforms, and blended learning tools to enhance teaching.
	Collaborate with colleagues to support cross-curricular language integration.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in French Language, Literature, or a related field.
	Teaching qualification or certification is an advantage.
	Proven proficiency in oral and written French.
	Experience teaching French to primary school students.
	Strong classroom management and communication skills.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Teams, Zoom, and other learning platforms.
	Patient, creative, and passionate about teaching languages.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV (Word format only) to: hr@standardbearersschool.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

2.) ICT Teacher

Job Location: Lekki Phase 1, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	The ICT Teacher will deliver engaging lessons in technology and coding, equipping students with essential digital skills for the 21st century.


Job Duties


	Teach ICT lessons across assigned classes, balancing theory and practice.
	Design and deliver coding lessons using Scratch and other child-friendly platforms.
	Introduce students to basic programming, digital literacy, and problem-solving through technology.
	Support students in developing creativity, collaboration, and critical thinking using digital tools.
	Ensure proper use and care of ICT equipment, including classroom devices and software.
	Work with other teachers to integrate ICT into different subjects.
	Stay updated on new educational technologies and recommend tools that enhance learning.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent qualification in ICT, Computer Science, or related field.
	Teaching certification and relevant classroom experience.
	Strong knowledge of Scratch and other children’s coding platforms.
	Ability to simplify complex ICT concepts for young learners.
	Passion for teaching and inspiring creativity through technology.
	Good classroom management and communication skills.
	Commitment to continuous professional development in educational technology.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@standardbearersschool.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

3.) School Technician / Site Supervisor

Job Location: Lekki Phase 1, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Description


	We are hiring a School Technician / Site Supervisor to handle electrical, plumbing, lighting, and general facility maintenance.
	The role includes supervising junior staff, ensuring smooth daily operations, and overseeing repairs and preventive maintenance.


Requirements


	OND / HND / Bachelor’s Degree with 2–5 years of relevant experience, strong technical and supervisory skills, and good knowledge of electrical/plumbing systems.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@standardbearersschool.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: Applications should be submitted in Word format only.
